name: Barnyard Squabble
description:
DePaul University 2019-2020 Capstone project

Barnyard Squabble is a 2D, local multiplayer collection of barn animal-themed mini-games.

CONSOLE CONTROLLERS REQUIRED

Cat Rancher

The goal of this game is to collect the most amount of cats as possible. Each player will need to pick up cats, and put them into their pins. Players can steal cats from other peoples pins, and can run into other players to make them drop their cats they are holding. The player with the most cats at the end of the game wins. 

Keep Away

The goal of this game is to keep the object for as long as possible. You are able to through the object at other players to stun them for a bit. Person at the end of the most points wins.

Tag

The goal of this game is to be “it” for the less amount of time, just like the childhood game all of us played.

Mountain Top

The goal of this game is to be the last person standing on the area. Players will be able to push each other off the ledge and into holes in the middle of the arena. Last person standing in the area wins.

King of the Hill

The goal of this game is to maintain control of the moving objective by standing on it. Players can push each other out of the way, and occasionally must maneuver obstacles.

Developers:

Michael Struck - Level Design

Jared Walsh - Programming

Jonathan Rose - Programming

William  Roberson - Level Design

Brianne Almalvez - 2D Art

Christian Horton - 3D Modeling & Design
